perturbation.original_text: Section 5.3 Invoices. Provider shall submit or cause to be submitted to Recipient in writing, within 15 days after the end of each month, an invoice setting forth the Fees for the Services provided to Recipient during such month in reasonable detail, as applicable, due under such invoice. Section 5.4 Payment. Recipient shall pay, or cause to be paid, the Fees shown on an invoice no later than the last business day of the month Recipient received such invoice unless disputed in accordance with Section 5.7. Any amount not received from the invoiced Party within such period shall bear interest at the Applicable Rate, from and including the last date of such period to, but excluding, the date of payment.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 5.3 Invoices. Provider shall submit or cause to be submitted to Recipient in writing, within 15 days after the end of each month, an invoice setting forth the Fees for the Services provided to Recipient during such month in reasonable detail, as applicable, due under such invoice. Section 5.4 Payment. Recipient shall pay, or cause to be paid, the Fees shown on an invoice no later than 30 days after the Recipient received such invoice unless disputed in accordance with Section 5.7. Any amount not received from the invoiced Party within 15 days of the due date shall bear interest at the Applicable Rate, from and including the last date of such period to, but excluding, the date of payment.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the payment deadline and when interest accrues. Section 5.4 initially states payment is due by the last business day of the month the invoice is received. The revised text states that payment is due 30 days after receipt of the invoice. Furthermore, interest was initially applied if amounts were not received by the due date. The modified text states that interest only applies if amounts are not received within 15 days of the due date. This discrepancy could lead to disputes about when payments are considered late and when interest applies.

perturbation.original_text: Section 6.1 Term of Services. With respect to each of the Services, the term thereof will be for a period commencing as of the date hereof, unless a different date is specified as the commencement date for any applicable Service on Exhibit A or Exhibit B (either, a "Commencement Date"), and shall continue until 12 months following the Commencement Date unless (i) such other date as is specified as the termination date for any applicable Service in this Agreement or on Exhibit A or Exhibit B, as applicable (the "Term") or (ii) earlier terminated pursuant to this Agreement (a "Termination Date").
perturbation.changed_text: Section 6.1 Term of Services. Notwithstanding the foregoing, certain services as defined in Exhibit A, section G1.4, shall automatically renew for an additional 12-month period unless the Recipient provides written notice of non-renewal at least 30 days prior to the initial termination date.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the term and termination of services, specifically for services defined in Exhibit A, section G1.4. While Section 6.1 initially sets the term as 12 months following the Commencement Date, the addition states that services in Exhibit A, section G1.4, automatically renew unless a notice of non-renewal is provided. This creates a contradiction as to whether the term is definitively 12 months or can be extended without explicit agreement, leading to uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: Section 6.2 Termination of Services. Except as agreed by the Parties in writing or as otherwise stated in the Exhibits, Company may terminate for convenience any Transition Service, and RGHI may terminate for convenience any Reverse Transition Service, upon 30 days' prior written notice of such termination; provided, (a) that, with respect to the Services described in Section G1 of Exhibit A, unless otherwise indicated therein, those Services may not be terminated independently except in accordance with an agreed Migration Plan and, (b) any unamortized costs associated with Provider's purchase of any license or other costs incurred specifically for the purpose of providing the Services hereunder will be passed through to the Terminating Party.
